title: Leadership Practical Competency Enhancement: Venous Ulcers and Compression Therapy: Constructivist Project-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Analyze the etiology, symptoms, and diagnostic criteria of venous ulcers in context-specific scenarios.
Design principles and application techniques of compression therapy tailored to patient characteristics.

Learners select three nursing intervention scenarios within one week, complete a simulation project using five or more multimedia resources (videos, infographics, quizzes), and submit deliverables meeting peer evaluation and instructor feedback criteria (≥4 out of 5 points).

Learners evaluate the clinical validity of two pressure therapy plans based on ≥3 peer feedbacks using a 5-point rubric (validity, feasibility, safety criteria) and derive an average evaluation result of ≥4 points.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
